skill.name: lamindb
skill.description: This skill should be used when working with LaminDB, an open-source data framework for biology that makes data queryable, traceable, reproducible, and FAIR. Use when managing biological datasets (scRNA-seq, spatial, flow cytometry, etc.), tracking computational workflows, curating and validating data with biological ontologies, building data lakehouses, or ensuring data lineage and reproducibility in biological research. Covers data management, annotation, ontologies (genes, cell types, diseases, tissues), schema validation, integrations with workflow managers (Nextflow, Snakemake) and MLOps platforms (W&B, MLflow), and deployment strategies.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when working with LaminDB, an open-source data framework for biology that ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing markdown files with LaminDB guidance and Python examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file access, or environment variable reads by the skill itself. All content is informational reference material.

content.user_title: Manage LaminDB workflows with clear guidance
content.value_statement: Biology data is hard to trace and validate across pipelines. This skill guides you through LaminDB patterns for lineage, querying, and ontology-based curation.
actual_capabilities: Explain LaminDB core entities such as Artifacts, Records, Runs, and Transforms with practical examples.
Provide query and filtering patterns for registries, features, and artifact metadata with Q objects.
Outline validation workflows using DataFrameCurator or AnnDataCurator with schema definitions.
Describe ontology import, search, and standardization with Bionty registries for cell types and genes.
Summarize integration patterns for Nextflow, Snakemake, MLflow, Weights and Biases, and HuggingFace.
Guide setup options for local SQLite or cloud storage with PostgreSQL and S3 configurations.
limitations: Does not execute LaminDB code or access your databases directly.
Cannot verify cloud credentials or storage permissions for your environment.
Guidance may need adjustment for your specific LaminDB version and setup.
Does not replace official documentation or compliance review for regulated workflows.

use_cases.title: Curate scRNA-seq datasets
use_cases.description: Plan validation and ontology mapping steps for single-cell artifacts in LaminDB with schema design.

use_cases.title: Design LaminDB deployment
use_cases.description: Choose storage, database, and sync settings for team deployments with cloud options.

use_cases.title: Track model data lineage
use_cases.description: Connect training runs to datasets and features for reproducible experiments with W&B or MLflow.

prompt_templates.title: Start with core concepts
prompt_templates.scenario: New to LaminDB and want a quick map
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain LaminDB core entities and how artifacts, records, runs, and transforms relate in a simple workflow.

prompt_templates.title: Plan data validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a validation plan for a CSV dataset, including required fields, standardization, and ontology mapping in LaminDB.

prompt_templates.title: Query patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Show query patterns for filtering artifacts by features, dates, and provenance, and explain when to use Q objects.

prompt_templates.title: Deployment decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare local SQLite and cloud PostgreSQL setups, including storage options and team collaboration tradeoffs.

output_examples.input: Create a validation plan for an AnnData dataset with cell type annotations
output: Define required fields such as cell_id, cell_type, and donor_id in the Feature registry.
Create an AnnData schema with slots for obs and var metadata validation.
Standardize cell_type using a Cell Ontology registry for terminology consistency.
Initialize AnnDataCurator with your schema and validate each slot.
Save the curated artifact with linked ontology feature sets for queryability.

best_practices: Define schemas early and reuse them across datasets for consistency.
Link artifacts to runs and transforms to maintain clear lineage tracking.
Use ontology standardization before analysis and data sharing workflows.
anti_patterns: Saving unvalidated data without schema definitions or curation.
Creating new keys instead of using built-in versioning for data changes.
Mixing local and cloud instances without explicit sync and migration rules.

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides guidance and prompts that work across those platforms for LaminDB workflows.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not run LaminDB code, access your storage, or verify credentials. It provides guidance only.

faq.question: Can it help with Nextflow or MLflow integration?
faq.answer: Yes, it outlines integration patterns and common setup steps for workflow managers and MLOps platforms.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, this skill only provides instructions and documentation. It does not read or transmit any data.

faq.question: What if setup fails or commands do not work?
faq.answer: Check your LaminDB version, dependencies, storage permissions, and credentials. Consult the official docs for troubleshooting.

faq.question: How is it different from general data management skills?
faq.answer: It is specific to LaminDB entities, lineage tracking, biological ontologies, and bioinformatics data formats.
